data.translated:
Gaya 1 (Simple):

> Teruskan membina!

Gaya 2 (Slightly more casual):

> Keep building, bro/sis!


Gaya 3 (Adding a bit of local flavour - implying perseverance in the crypto space):

> Keep building!  Jangan give up, wallet kita kena tebal! (Don't give up, our wallets need to be thick!)


The best option depends on the specific context and your target audience within the Malaysian crypto community.  The first two are perfectly acceptable and easily understood. The third one adds a bit more personality and relatability.

data.original: The rest of investing is to do the opposite. 🤷‍♂️
data.translated:
Lain-lain pelaburan? Buat je benda sebaliknya. 🤷‍♂️  (or)

Bab pelaburan lain?  Buat sebaliknya je la. 🤷‍♂️


Both options maintain the casual tone and use "wallet," "futures," and "mining" as is,  as those terms are commonly used in English even within the local crypto community.
